text.headline: Higher-spec mask mandates in 2021
text.text: Surgical masks only offer 50% protection, and cloth face coverings have lower protection still. With this realization, mandates for higher filtration masks are being enacted. Each country should have setup domestic manufacturing in the last 10 months to facilitate that. Click the right arrow ☞

text.headline: Along with vaccine rollouts, the U.S. needs a National Hi-Fi Mask Initiative
text.text: Doctors Abraar Karan, Ranu Dhillon, and Devabhaktuni Srikrishna, in an op-ed article call for a National Hi-Fi Mask Initiative (USA). That's N95 or equivalent - and getting everyone in them ASAP. See also CNN op-ed

text.headline: German State: Bavaria orders compulsory FFP2 masks on public transport and in shops
text.text: From next Monday, people in Bavaria will have to wear FFP2 mouth and nose coverings while travelling on public transport and when in shops. State premier Markus Söder, of Angela Merkel's CDU sister party the Christian Social Union (CSU), announced the changes after a cabinet meeting in Munich on Tuesday. Söder said that the "normal community masks" were for the protection of others during the pandemic. FFP2 masks, which are available in pharmacies, also protect the wearer. See also Süddeutsche Zeitung and Die Zeit articles in German

media.credit: Credit: Vincent Catala of Agence Vu

text.headline: Article: Why Aren’t We Wearing Better Masks?
text.text: Zeynep Tufekci and Jeremy Howard wrote a call-to-arms article for The Atlantic. Both have been selling masks hard to the west since the start. In this article they make a case for better masks for all. This is to the world, not just the USA where they reside.

media.caption: Say goodbye to cloth masks. Say hello to tight-fitting surgical masks or even N95s.

text.headline: Article Section: Get a better mask (Vox)
text.text: “The fact that [the variants] are so infectious suggests to me having a better mask is a good idea,” Frieden said. When it comes to avoiding an infection, “a surgical mask is better than a cloth mask, a tight-fitting surgical mask is better than a loose-fitting mask, and an N95 is better than a surgical mask.”

text.headline: Austria: New mandatory masks FFP2 on busses and in shops
text.text: “As of January 25, higher-quality FFP2 masks must be worn on public transportation and when shopping. These are to be offered at cost price in supermarkets. The government does not name a price, but it should be “very, very compatible”. At present, corresponding masks are available from about 1.50 euros. For income-poor ones they are to be made available free of charge”

media.caption: The German health minister, Jens Spahn, wears a FFP2 protective mask

text.headline: Germany: Considers FFP2 mandates for the country
text.text: “Germany is weighing up following Austria and Bavaria’s lead in making it compulsory to wear full protective filter masks on public transport and in shops, as the country remains on high alert about the impact of possible coronavirus mutations. The Austrian chancellor, Sebastian Kurz, announced on Sunday that wearing single-use filtering facepiece respirator, or FFP2, masks would become mandatory on public transport and in shops from 25 January, as the Alpine state moves to extend its national lockdown until 7 February.”

media.caption: Euronews video interview with Dr. Simon.Kolstoe

text.headline: Face masks: What's the difference between a cloth one and an FFP2?
text.text: As authorities in southern Germany and in Austria make FFP2 masks mandatory on public transport and in shops, Euronews asks an expert Dr. Simon.Kolstoe what difference these masks make.

text.headline: Europe’s growing mask ask: Ditch the cloth ones for medical-grade coverings
text.text: Washington Post Article: More about the decision in Germany and Daniel Camus (France's health advisory council):  “Since we don’t have any new weapons against [new variants], the only thing we can do is improve the ones we already have,” (meaning masks).

media.caption: Pete Buttigieg and Chasten Buttigieg wearing double masks for the inauguration

text.headline: Article: Two Masks Are the New Masks
text.text: Double-masking is a sensible and easy way to lower your risk when you have to spend more time around others — in a taxi, on a train or plane, or at an inauguration [New York Times]

text.headline: Czech Republic: Considering FFP2
text.text: The Czech Republic is weighing up following Austria and Bavaria’s lead in making it compulsory to wear full protective filter masks on public transport and in shops. [PragueMorning.cz]

text.headline: France bans certain homemade Covid masks for use in public
text.text: France has issued a decree banning certain homemade masks from being worn in public, saying they do not offer sufficient protection from the newer, more contagious Covid-19 variants.

media.caption: A nurse poses for a portrait with an N95 mask
media.credit: Credit: Biz Herman for The Washington Post

text.headline: Opinion: Everyone should be wearing N95 masks now
text.text: The masks I’m referring to, of course, are N95s. These are cheap — pre-pandemic they cost about 50 cents — and easy to manufacture. Yet our country has failed to invoke the Defense Production Act to produce enough masks for health-care workers and other essential workers [Joseph G. Allen, Op-ed]

text.headline: Italy: It might make sense to make FFP2 mandatory in some settings
text.text: “It is clear that the Ffp2 have a greater filtering capacity than surgical or community masks. So it might make sense to make them mandatory on board buses or inside closed rooms, but there is a supply problem as well as a cost problem, ” - Agostino Miozzo of the Scientific Technical Committee.

media.caption: Fitter by bellus3d.com - one of many choices

text.headline: CDC: Wear Mask Fitters for Better COVID-19 Protection
text.text: “Fitters have been scientifically demonstrated to improve filtration performance by as much as 90% or more,” John Brooks, MD, chief medical officer of the CDC’s COVID-19 Response, said Friday during a media briefing with the Infectious Diseases Society of America.

text.headline: Congress and senate members implore Biden to distribute and increase supply of high quality masks
text.text: Schiff, Khanna, Sanders, Schatz Send Bicameral Letter to President Biden Encouraging Distribution and Increased Supply of High Quality Masks

media.credit: A quarantine hotel in Australia - ABC

text.headline: Victoria, Australia: N95s for workers in quarantine hotels
text.text: Mask rules and the testing regime for workers will be tightened in Victoria's quarantine system after the worker contracted the virus. Epidemiologists believe all staff working in hotel quarantine should wear N95 masks, which provide a higher level of protection.

media.caption: Prof. Linsey Marr talking about better masks

text.headline: Article: Is It Time to Upgrade Your Mask?
text.text: [NPR article] For further protection, you may want to consider “double-masking” — putting one mask over the other. Wearing a cloth mask over a medical procedure mask can reduce people’s exposure by as much as 96.4% when two people interacting with one another are both double masked, the CDC found, if both people double-masked

text.headline: Two Masks Are Better Than One, CDC Says
text.text: Turns out wearing two masks really is better than one. New research from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finds that double-masking can vastly improve protection from the coronavirus. The CDC is offering updated advice on face coverings as new, more transmissible variants of the coronavirus spread.

media.caption: One of the quarantine hotels in Australia

text.headline: Australia: Quarantine Hotel workers to wear N95
text.text: "In the state of Victoria, hotel staff now have to be equipped with a type of mask known as an N95, roughly equivalent to what is called an FFP2 in the UK." (BBC). See also The Age article

media.caption: Camila Soler shows three models of the masks

text.headline: Baleric Islands: Demand for FFP2 masks increases
text.text: "The demand for FFP2 masks has increased in Mallorca, Ibiza and Formentera (Minorca has its own cooperative) due to the fact that in other European countries such as France or Germany where they are mandatory"

text.headline: Former Biden coronavirus advisers push White House to more widely recommend use of N95 masks
text.text: Several members of President Joe Biden's former coronavirus advisory board are urging his administration to more widely recommend and mandate the use of N95 masks, citing a "pressing and urgent need for action" driven by the threat of new coronavirus variants [CNN]

text.headline: New Standards Will Help You Choose an Effective COVID-19 Face Mask
text.text: You could soon start seeing new labels that cover filtration efficiency, fit, and breathability. [...] Manufacturers will be encouraged to comply with the standard, and consumers [in the USA] will be able to have confidence in compliant products, knowing that they meet the standard.

media.caption: letter written by Royal Collage of Nursing (UK)

text.headline: UK, Letter Re: Protecting health care workers - better ventilation, PPE, awareness and research
text.text: Versus HCWs in surgical style masks today: "The current UK Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) guidance which leads and determines the selection and use of PPE across the UK does not accurately depict the airborne risks when sharing health and care settings including working in patients’ homes and public buildings. [...] Amend the UK guidance to reflect and increase the level of respiratory protection as a precautionary principle [for HCWs] ..."

text.headline: Czech Republic: FFP2 Respirators To be Mandatory in Public Transport
text.text: "On Monday, the Ministry of Health will order the wearing of FFP2 respirators, nano-filtered face masks or two surgical facemasks in public transport and other public places, said Minister of Health Jan Blatný (ANO) after the government meeting.". Czechia was an ealy masking country too - see other timeline

text.headline: USA: Nurses, Unions, Allies Urge CDC to Acknowledge Covid-19 Aerosol Transmission to Help Bring Virus Under Control
text.text: Multiple trades unions grouped together for this press release calling for recognition of airborne transmission and "improved PPE"

text.headline: Canada: N95 must be worn in residential and long-term care centres (CHSLD) decrees a judge
text.text: "A judge in Canada has ruled that surgical masks *do not protect LTC workers against covid-19* so all workers in LTCs should be provided N95s." See <a href='https://twitter.com/lisa_iannattone/status/1374526185980444672?s=21'>@lisa_iannattone thread for English summary</>

text.headline: Singapore: Wear a mask with high filtration capability, not just any cloth mask: Finance minister
text.text:
"Masks with high filtration capabilities should be worn, especially when going to enclosed places with people in close proximity, said Finance Minister Lawrence Wong.

These include surgical masks or one with a filtration insert, and not just any cloth mask, he said as he urged Singaporeans to stay at home to slow the spread of Covid-19 during this "critical period"."

text.headline: Article: Lufthansa, Air France & Finnair Ban Fabric Face Masks on Their Flights
text.text: Imperfect as the airlines are still allowing surgical/medical mask (which have 50% protection) but are otherwise encouraging hih spec masks

text.headline: Article: RIP cloth masks? Why airlines and governments are banning them
text.text: "Cloth masks, a staple of the pandemic, are now banned on some airlines and in public spaces in Germany and Austria, because there are no standards guiding their efficacy."
